techmeme.title: Okta fixes a flaw present since July 23, 2024 that, under specific conditions, let users log in with any password if the account's username had 52+ characters (Richard Lawler/The Verge)

An interview with EssilorLuxottica CEO Francesco Milleri on the Meta partnership, smart glasses replacing smartphones, and more, as the firm is valued at €100B (Silvia Sciorilli Borrelli/Financial Times)
Microsoft and a16z jointly share US public policy ideas for AI startups, saying "regulation should be implemented only if its benefits outweigh its costs" (Microsoft)
Nvidia will replace Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average on November 8, after Amazon replaced Walgreens in February; Intel joined the index in 1999 (Bloomberg)
Polymarket user Fredi9999, a self-described Frenchman, says he bet $30M+ on Trump after analyzing polls; he can't exit his wagers without crashing the market (Alexander Osipovich/Wall Street Journal)
